an1.15:1: "Bhikkhus, I do not see even one other thing on account of which unarisen doubt arises and arisen doubt increases and expands so much as careless attention.[n.26]Mpcites Dhs 205 (Be §67) for a definition of the hindrance of doubt(vicikicchānīvaraṇa)as doubt about the Buddha, the Dhamma, the Saṅgha, and the training (see tooAN5.205).For one who attends carelessly, unarisen doubt arises and arisen doubt increases and expands."
